intro: Vincetoxicum striatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ironweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a distinctive veining pattern. Vincetoxicum striatum thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in partial to full shade.
